wikitext.*:
'''SMAL''', is a [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]] signifying "yellow".<ref name=LR>{{LR|Etymologies}}, pp. 386-7 (root appearing as "SMAL-")</ref>
==Derivatives<ref name=LR/>==

*[[Primitive Quendian]]: ''smalinā'' ("yellow")
**[[Quenya]]: ''malina'' ("yellow")
**[[Kornoldorin|Old Noldorin]]: ''malina'' ("yellow")
***[[Noldorin]]: ''malen'' ("yellow")

*[[Primitive Quendian]]: ''smaldā'' ("[[gold]] (as metal)")
**[[Quenya]]: ''[[malda]]'' ("gold (as metal)")
**[[Kornoldorin|Old Noldorin]]: ''malda'' ("gold (as metal)")
***[[Noldorin]]: ''[[malt]]'' ("gold (as metal)"); ''malthen'', ''[[mallen]]'' ("of gold")

*[[Primitive Quendian]]: ''smalu'' ("pollen, yellow powder")
**[[Quenya]]: ''malo'' ("pollen, yellow powder")
**[[Kornoldorin|Old Noldorin]]: ''malo'' ("pollen, yellow powder")
***[[Noldorin]]: ''mâl'' ("pollen, yellow powder")

*[[Primitive Quendian]]: ''smalwā'' ("fallow, pale")
**[[Quenya]]: ''malwa'' ("fallow, pale")
**[[Noldorin]]: ''malw'' ("fallow, pale")

*[[Primitive Quendian]]: ''asmalē'', ''asmalindē'' ("yellow bird, 'yellow hammer'")<ref group="note">The "ē" in ''asmalindē'' also carries the  diacritical mark [[Wikipedia:Breve|breve]], as in "ĕ". Cf. {{VT|46a}}, p. 14</ref> 
**[[Quenya]]: ''ammale'', ''ambale'' ("yellow bird, 'yellow hammer'")
**[[Kornoldorin|Old Noldorin]]: ''ammale'', ''ammalinde'' ("yellow bird, 'yellow hammer'")
***[[Noldorin]]: ''e(m)melin'', ''emlin'' ("yellow bird, 'yellow hammer'")
